law.catch_line: A court may exercise personal jurisdiction over a nonresident defendant alleged to be the father in ...
law.text:
A court may exercise personal jurisdiction over a nonresident defendant alleged to be the father in a paternity proceeding if:
The mother resides in this State at the time the suit is filed;
The nonresident alleged father personally has been served with process in accordance with the Maryland Rules; and
The act of conception is alleged to have occurred in this State.
